page.title: 10The Windmill at Norwell
page.content: Norwell once had 3 mills, a watermill, a windmill in North field and the one still standing off Main Street. Built in{1852}this mill worked until 1922, for the last 6 years operating with 2 sails. The machinery was all sold for scrap and the top 12 feet of brickwork removed when a former owner wished to convert the mill to a dwelling. Planning permission was refused. The{Gregory's}bought the shell of the tower in{1977}and built a bungalow alongside the mill, hoping to restore the mill to full working order. {1985}saw the beginning of restoration work with the rebuilding and tarring of the tower. The next step is to renew the beams and floor before building a new cap. Hopefully Norwell windmill will be grinding flour again by{1992.
